The [Root.Religion.GetPriestTitle]s in the [Root.GetHouseOfWorship] would tell me [satanists_recruiter.GetDWDevil] is a teacher of sin, but perhaps his teachings should not be so easily dismissed...

J'ai commencé à étudier les livres sur l'occulte, car jusqu'ici, j'ai trouvé étroites d'esprit, au mieux, les idées exprimées [Root.GetHouseOfWorship].
column4: Es ist einige Zeit her, seitdem [satanists_recruiter.GetTitledFirstName] mich das letzte Mal kontaktierte. Ich habe mir den Kopf darüber zerbrochen, was [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName] wohl von mir denkt, aber [satanists_recruiter.GetFirstName] hat mir bereits Unterstützung angeboten. Ich studiere nun okkulte Werke und bisher scheinen mir die herkömmlichen Predigten im Vergleich bestenfalls engstirnig.
column6: Ha pasado un tiempo desde aquella conversación con [satanists_recruiter.GetTitledFirstName]. Por otro lado, [satanists_recruiter.GetFirstName] ya me ha ofrecido más apoyo del que [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName] me ha dado. He empezado a estudiar libros sobre ocultismo y me estoy dando cuenta de cuan intransigentes eran los preceptos que me habían enseñado hasta ahora.

column2: There are many deities whom you can chose to follow. The supreme ruler, our Father Wotan. For luck in war pray to the Thunderer Thunær, or for prosperity pray to Inguin.
Wise Wotan, I shall serve you faithfully.
My prayers go to bountiful Inguin.
I will bring you honor on the battlefield, mighty Thunær!

Wotan, the All-Father, is the supreme ruler of all Gods and Goddessess. He has created all that which is good and wonderful in this world, including us. His rule is one of peace and understanding, and those are his gifts to faithful followers.
The bountiful Inguin, god of sunshine and fair weather will bestow prosperity and virility on those who follow him.

Thunær is the God of Thunder. He rides the skies in his chariot, with his magical hammer in his hand. His eternal enemy is the World-Serpent, whom he protects us from. Those who are faithful to Thunær will be given his courage and success.

You have toiled devoutly in your endeavor to follow the path of Wotan. In his name you have promote peace and understanding between your subjects. As a result, your diplomatic skills have been improving.

You have toiled devoutly in your endeavor to follow the path of Thunær. In his name you have practiced your axemanship and spent many hours strategizing at the war table with your commanders. As a result, your martial skills have been improving.

You have toiled devoutly in your endeavor to follow the path of Inguin. In his name you have arranged harvest festivals and fertility rites, as well as spent many hours inspecting the fields of [Root.Capital.GetName]. As a result, your stewardship skills have been improving.

It is a fine day and you are out hunting with a small party. As you take a break to eat your midday meal, you find yourself in a discussion on archery with [From.GetTitledFirstName]. It turns out that [From.GetSheHe] is also a devout follower of Thunær. The longer you talk the more you seem to have in common!

Many find it odd that a [Root.GetTitle] works in the fields, but tending to the land and crops make you feel closer to Inguin, more so than any prayer. As you take a short break, you notice [From.GetTitledFirstName] approaching. You greet and exchange some words about the harvest. It turns out that [From.GetSheHe] is also a follower of Inguin!

It is early morning and you are at the shrine dedicated to Wotan, deep in prayers. You hear soft footsteps behind you – who could it be at this hour? [From.GetTitledFirstName], as it turns out. You exchange some pleasantries and soon you find yourself in a full-fledged conversation. You have so much in common!

You sit huddled up together by the fire, the air thick with tension. The skies outside are dark with heavy clouds and Thunær's presence is as tangible as a lover's touch. Suddenly, the room is lit by a bright flash and an ear-deafening crack cuts through the silence. Your [GetFromRelation] [From.GetFirstName] breaks into tears.

You are dancing at the fertility rite held in Inguin's honor as your eyes find [From.GetTitledFirstName]'s across the bonfire. For a moment, it is as if the whole world turns silent. The drumming is a distant thunder, yet the rhythmic vibrations run through your body, to your very core...
Tonight, I shall bed [From.GetFirstName] in the name of Inguin.
Your reputation as a devout follower of Thunær has spread across the lands. Many great and seasoned warriors have since traveled to [Root.Capital.GetName] to pledge their allegiance to your cause.

In your efforts to become more like the good Wotan, you have begun treating everyone who crosses your path with more understanding and respect. As a result, you have become known for your compassionate ways and noble nature. Some go as far as calling you "the Voice of Wotan".

Your efforts to make the most out Inguin's holy soil has turned you into a true inspiration for your people. Their hard work, in combination with the fair weather which the God has blessed you with, has resulted in the richest harvest in many years. Celebrations in Inguin's honor is held in every village.
I shall erect a monument in the honor of Wotan.

column4: Ich werde ein Monument zu Ehren von Wotan errichten.
column6: Erigiré un monumento en honor a Wotan.

column2: Finally the monument is finished. It turned out just as you envisioned it, or perhaps even better. To celebrate its completion, a grand ceremony was held in Wotan' honor, and what a ceremony indeed! Tales of it will be told for as long as the monument stands watch over [Root.Capital.GetName].

Finally the monument is finished. It turned out just as you envisioned it, or perhaps even better. To celebrate its completion, a grand ceremony was held in Inguin' honor, and what a ceremony indeed! Tales of it will be told for as long as the monument stands watch over [Root.Capital.GetName].

Finally the monument is finished. It turned out just as you envisioned it, or perhaps even better. To celebrate its completion, a grand ceremony was held in Thunær' honor, and what a ceremony indeed! Tales of it will be told for as long as the monument stands watch over [Root.Capital.GetName].

Lately, you have been enganging in long philosophical conversations with [From.GetFirstNameWithNick], your court guru. You have been discussing Bön, and how you can become master over your desires and weaknessess and eliminate the suffering they cause in your soul.

My preparations are done and the time has come to begin my pilgrimage to Purang. Soon I shall experience the tranquility and enlightenment of the holy Mountain Kailash and the place where Drenpa Namkha was born.
I have packed my things and made preparations for my household to make do without me. It is time to set out for the Kawagarbo peaks.
I have packed my things and made preparations for my household to make do without me. It is time to set out for Monasteries of Lhasa.

Any traveller would balk at the prospect of traversing mountains and hils but it was the shorter route. Emerging under ever-steeper mountains however, it is becoming increasingly clear that I have made a mistake. The road ahead is not necessarily as dangerous as what now lies behind, but it is quite clearly not the right road.

A large group of mounted warriors block our way. The local warlord is a man that has taken it upon himself to relieve pilgrims, merchants or other travelers of some of their wealth in order to allow them passage. Turning back is not an option, either we pay or we will have to fight these men.

It has been days since we last saw a settlement and deep forests surround us on all sides. The small road we have been following has all but disappeared in the thick undergrowth. As I look up I can make out a huge creature native to this land on the other side.

You come across a thriving city in the middle of a dry upland. The secret of their prosperity seems to be huge water tanks, built and maintained by the local ruler. A separate reservoir is also under construction to allow the city to grow even bigger. You stop to admire this feat of engineering and cannot help wondering how much a similar construction could benefit [Root.Capital.GetName].
Arrival in Purang

The peaks of the holy Mountain Kailash can be seen in the distance. This is the place where Heavens meet the Earth and where spiritual realm of Tagzig Olmo Lung Ring is located.\n\nThis is where Bönpo worshipers come seeking Enlightenment through purification of the bodymind and mindstream of all obscurations.
I too seek to be enlightened
Kawagarbo

You have finally arrived in Kawagarbo, by many considered the principal pilgrimage site for the Bönpo faithful. Over the centuries rulers and rich pilgrims from many lands have contributed to a great number of temples, monasteries and shrines at this post. Numerous local monks maintain the these temples and shrines in honor of the Warrior God.
It is time I proceed to the temples and mathas of this place.
Sanchi

You have finally arrived in Lhasa, one of the oldest centers of Bön worship in the world. Legend says that the temple of Jokhang was built by King Songtsen Gampo for his two brides who brought many sacred relics to the temple from their homelands. Ever since Bönpo have been coming here to seek out the serenely secluded environment, and over the years more temples, stupas and monasteries have sprung up around this ideal place for monastic life.\n\nAs you approach the olderst part of the monastery you reflect on the generations of faithful that have walked this way before you.
It is time I proceed to the temples and mathas of this place.
I will go to Purang, where Drenpa Namkha was born.
I will go to the monasteries of Lhasa.
I will go to Peaks of Kawagarbo, home of the Warrior God.
The Achilles' Spear

Your relic hunter [relic_hunter.GetTitledFirstName] returns from [relic_hunter.GetHerHis] lengthy travels to your court. Once in your presence, [relic_hunter.GetSheHe] produces an old, yet well preserved spear. With a broad smile [relic_hunter.GetSheHe] hands it to you. 'My liege, I present you the spear of mighty Achilles'

You hold the spear in your hand, and immediately feel a flow of power from it. With it you can become the greatest Hellenic warrior since the spear's previous owner.

The [relic_hunter.GetManWoman] who made it possible smiles at your elation, waiting patiently...
Spartan Sword

A proud [relic_hunter.GetTitledFirstName] enters your throne room, a sword in [relic_hunter.GetHerHis] hands. [relic_hunter.GetSheHeCap] bows, and when [relic_hunter.GetSheHe] holds out the weapon you see it is an ancient rusty sword... 'My search has been long and difficult,' your [relic_hunter.GetJobTitle] says, 'but what I bring you is a weapon wielded by a true Spartan warrior'
